event: Earliest human presence in present-day Canada after Ice Age retreat
Indigenous cultures develop across Arctic, Plains, and woodlands
Norse establish a short-lived settlement in Newfoundland
John Cabot reaches Atlantic Canada for England
Jacques Cartier explores the St. Lawrence River
Quebec City is founded as New France’s capital
Hudson’s Bay Company is chartered, shaping fur trade routes
British defeat French forces at the Battle of Quebec
France cedes Canada to Britain under the Treaty of Paris
War of 1812 reinforces separation from the United States
Canadian Confederation creates a self-governing dominion
Canadian Pacific Railway links the country coast to coast
Statute of Westminster grants full legislative independence
Constitution is patriated, completing legal independence
